humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the invasive ductal carcinoma measures 11.0 cm in largest dimension, which falls under T3 in the T stage rules (T3 tumors are more than 5 cm). The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma, so the T stage for this patient is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for breast cancer is based on the size of the primary tumor. In this report, the primary tumor measures 11.0 cm in largest dimension (as stated in 'DIAGNOSIS: 5). BREAST AND LEVEL I AXILLARY LYMPH NODES, LEFT; MASTECTOMY: - INVASIVE DUCTAL CARCINOMA, HISTOLOGIC GRADK III/III (SLIGHT OR NO. TUBULE FORMATION). NUCLEAR GRADE II/III (MODERATE VARIATION IN SIZE AND. SHAPE) WITH AREAS OF LOBULAR GROWTH, MEASURING 11.0 CM IN LARGEST DIMENSION.'). Therefore, the T stage is T3, as T1 is up to 2 cm, T2 is 2-5 cm, and T4 is larger than 5 cm. T3 is for a tumor larger than 5 cm in greatest dimension.
